Given the unique orbital and axial characteristics of the tidally-heated forest moon of Xylophia-IV-e, as well as its position at the edge of the snow line and the influence of reflected light from the gas giant, it is plausible that the majority of the moon experiences a relatively stable temperature range. The temperature range of 13°C to 25°C (55°F to 77°F) you've suggested would provide a moderate, habitable climate for life to flourish in many parts of the moon, with the exception of the lowest and highest latitudes and altitudes.

In the lower and higher latitudes and altitudes, temperatures may fluctuate more, falling below 13°C or rising above 25°C. These temperature extremes would create unique climate zones, such as the tropical rainforests near the equator, and the hemiboreal or boreal rainforests in the circumpolar regions. The diverse temperature range across the moon would lead to a variety of ecosystems, each with distinct flora and fauna adapted to the specific climatic conditions.

Overall, the moderate temperature range of 13°C to 25°C across most of the moon would contribute to the development of lush forests and diverse ecosystems, providing a fascinating backdrop for an ecopunk adventure.
